Docs.summary: A channel that can read bytes into a sequence of buffers.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Read(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] dsts) cil managed
Public Function Read (dsts As ByteBuffer()) As Long

Docs.param: The buffers into which bytes are to be transferred
Docs.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from this channel into the given buffers.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes read, possibly zero, or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this read operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel has not been opened in a mode that permits reading.

MemberSignature.Value: public long Read (Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[]? dsts, int offset, int length);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Read(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] dsts, int32 offset, int32 length) cil managed
Public Function Read (dsts As ByteBuffer(), offset As Integer, length As Integer) As Long
public: long Read(cli::array <Java::Nio::ByteBuffer ^> ^ dsts, int offset, int length);
abstract member Read : Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] * int * int -> int64

Docs.param: The buffers into which bytes are to be transferred
The offset within the buffer array of the first buffer into which bytes are to be transferred; must be non-negative and no larger than dsts.length
The maximum number of buffers to be accessed; must be non-negative and no larger than dsts.length - offset
Docs.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from this channel into a subsequence of the given buffers.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes read, possibly zero, or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this read operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if offset or length , or if offset + length is greater than the size of buffers.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel has not been opened in a mode that permits reading.
